content.text: Solve the inequality \(x(2x - 1) > 15.\)
Given that \(y = (12 - 4x)^5\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Hence find the approximate change in \(y\) as \(x\) increases from 0.5 to \(0.5 + p\), where \(p\) is small
Find the coefficient of \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((1 - 2x)^{7}\)
Find the coefficient of \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((1 + 3x^{2})(1 - 2x)^{7}\)
Without using a calculator, find the positive root of the equation
giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{2}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
there are no restrictions,
there must be at least 1 teacher on the council and more students than teachers
After the council is chosen, a chairperson and a secretary have to be selected from the 6 council members
Calculate the number of different ways in which a chairperson and a secretary can be selected
A school council of 6 people is to be chosen from a group of 8 students and 6 teachers. C
the number of different ways that the council can be selected if
In the space below sketch the graph of \(y = |(2x + 3)(2x - 7)|.\)
How many values of \(x\) satisfy the equation \(|(2x + 3)(2x - 7)| = 2x?\)
Express \(y\) in terms of \(x\)
Find the value of \(x\) and of \(y\) such that \(\frac{y}{x} = - 9\)

The variables \(x\) and \(y\) are related in such a way that when \(\frac{y}{x}\) is plotted against \(x\) a straight line is obtained, as shown in the graph. The line passes through the points (1, 3) and (3, \(-1\) )
Express the area, \(A \text{cm}^2\), of the sector in terms of \(r\)
Given that \(r\) can vary, find the stationary value of \(A\)
A sector of a circle, of radius \(r \text{cm}\), has a perimeter of \(200 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the time taken to fly from \(A\) to \(B\)
Calculate the bearing of \(B\) from \(A\)

An aircraft, whose speed in still air is \(350\mathrm{kmh}^{- 1}\), flies in a straight line from \(A\) to \(B\), a distance \(480\mathrm{km}\). There is a wind of \(50\mathrm{kmh}^{- 1}\) blowing from the north. The pilot sets a course of \(130^\circ\)
The line \(y = 2x + 10\) intersects the curve \(2x^{2} + 3xy - 5y + y^{2} = 218\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\)
Find the equation of the perpendicular bisector of \(AB\)
Solve
Solve \(3(1 - \tan y\cos y) = 5\cos^2 y - 2\), for \(0^{\circ}< y< 360^{\circ}\)
Solve \(3\sec^{2}z = 4\), for \(0<z<2\pi\) radians
Show that \(Q\) is the point \(\left(\mathrm{e} + \frac{1}{\mathrm{e}}, 0\right).\)
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{dx}} (x \ln x) = 1 + \ln x.\)
Hence find \(\int \ln x \mathrm{d}x\) and the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \ln x\) cutting the \(x\)-axis at the point (1, 0). The normal to the curve at the point \(P(\mathrm{e}, 1)\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at the point \(Q\)
Find the coordinates of \(B\)
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{dx}} [\mathrm{e}^{x}(\cos x + \sin x)] = 2\mathrm{e}^{x}\cos x.\)
Hence find \(\int \mathrm{e}^{x}\cos x \mathrm{d}x\) and the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \mathrm{e}^{x}\cos x\), cutting the \(x\)-axis at the point \(\left(\frac{\pi}{2}, 0\right)\). The
normal to the curve at the point \(A(0, 1)\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at the point \(B\)
Answer only one of the following two alternatives
